description.narrative: Established in 1955 by Mr. Mehmet Melih Sipahioglu, Tamek Gida ve Konsantre Sanayii ve Ticaret A.S. (Tamek or the Company) concentrates on two main areas: (i) fruit juice and concentrates; and (ii) processed food, including tomato and pepper pastes, ketchup, mayonnaise, canned and stewed products, ready dishes, pickles, jams and marmalades. The proposed corporate loan will be utilized for refinancing part of the Companys existing short-term debt, working capital requirement and additional/maintenance capital expenditures (collectively the Project).

The Project will have following development impact: - Increased Competition: The Project will strengthen Company's position in the market as well as improve its competitiveness, which in turn will promote the competition in the fast growing fruit juice and branded processed food sectors. - Local Supply Chain Linkages & Farmers Reached: The Company works with various distributors throughout Turkey and applies contracted farming for various raw materials. So, with the Project the Company would be able to (i) collaborate more with its distributors to increase efficiencies, (ii) support more individual farmers; and (iii) further extend its local supply chain coverage thanks to improved operational and financial performance at corporate level. - Job Preservation & Increased Tax Revenues: With the Project, the Company will be able to retain its existing labor force while improved financial performance would lead to higher revenues/profitability resulting in returns to the society in form of taxes.
